Directives: select-field

select-field

select-field(allow-blank, attribute, disable, direction, enableFiltering, filter, help, label, labelAttribute, options, placeholder, prevent-default-option, valueAttribute)

Renders a drop-down <select> menu along with an input label. This type of component works with large enumerations and can be configured to allow for a blank/empty selection by way of an allow-blank attribute.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
allow-blank attribute

The presence of this attribute indicates that an empty/blank selection should be allowed.
attribute String

Name of the attribute within the parent form-for directive's model object. This attributes specifies the data-binding target for the input. Dot notation (ex "address.street") is supported.
disable Boolean

Disable input element. (Note the name is disable and not disabled to avoid collisions with the HTML5 disabled attribute).
direction String

Specifies the select-field menu's vertical direction ('down', 'up', 'auto'). This attribute defaults to 'auto' which means that the menu will drop up or down based on its position within the viewport.
enableFiltering Boolean

Enable filtering of list via a text input at the top of the dropdown.
filter String

Two-way bindable filter string. $watch this property to load remote options based on filter text. (Refer to this Plunker demo for an example.)
help String

Optional help tooltip to display on hover. By default this makes use of the Angular Bootstrap tooltip directive and the Font Awesome icon set.
label String

Optional field label displayed before the drop-down. (Although not required, it is strongly suggested that you specify a value for this attribute.) HTML is allowed for this attribute.
labelAttribute String

Optional override for label key in options array. Defaults to "label".
options Array

Set of options, each containing a label and value key. The label is displayed to the user and the value is assigned to the corresponding model attribute on selection.
placeholder String

Optional placeholder text to display if no value has been selected. The text "Select" will be displayed if no placeholder is provided.
prevent-default-option attribute

Optional attribute to override default selection of the first list option. Without this attribute, lists with allow-blank will default select the first option in the options array.
valueAttribute String

Optional override for value key in options array. Defaults to "value".
Source:
  • directives/select-field.js, line 1
Example
// To use this component you'll first need to define a set of options. For instance:
$scope.genders = [
  { value: 'f', label: 'Female' },
  { value: 'm', label: 'Male' }
];

// To render a drop-down input using the above options:
<select-field attribute="gender"
              label="Gender"
              options="genders">
</select-field>

// If you want to make this attribute optional you can use the allow-blank attribute as follows:
<select-field attribute="gender"
              label="Gender"
              options="genders"
              allow-blank>
</select-field>
